item.title: Paul Hastings Adds Private Credit, Restructuring Partners From King & Spalding
item.description: Law firm Paul Hastings has bolstered its restructuring, special situations and private credit practices by hiring nine King & Spalding partners.

item.title: The Face of the Anti-Trump GOP Is Now Larry Hogan
item.description: The former Maryland governor is under fire from the Trump campaign as he runs for the Senate.

item.title: Trump Conviction and Biden Tapes Put New Pressure on Mike Johnson
item.description: The House speaker must decide whether to schedule a vote on a measure that seeks to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt of Congress.

item.title: Atos Assessing Two Revised Rescue Bids
item.description: Atos received revised bids from the two investor groups vying for control of the debt-laden French I.T. firm and said it will work with creditors to help it decide between the proposals this week.

item.title: Larger Oil Inventory Draws Expected to Support Prices Over the Summer
item.description: Crude should be supported by falling global inventories over the summer as seasonal demand increases, UBS said, although OPEC+’s decision to phase out its voluntary cuts from October could cause some price volatility in the near term.

item.title: France's Downgrade by S&P Could Filter Into Currently Stable OAT Spreads
item.description: France’s downgrade to AA- from AA by S&P “should put an upward pressure on French spreads,” Jefferies said, adding Friday’s move wasn’t a massive surprise for markets as a short France view had been the consensus since the start of the year.

item.title: China Electric-Vehicle Shares Rally After Strong Sales in May
item.description: Shares of Chinese electric-vehicle makers surged after some reported record sales in May, spurring hopes that more price cuts are around the corner as companies race to grow market share.

item.title: Metal Prices Mixed, With Gold Flat After Friday's Inflation Data
item.description: Gold futures were trading sideways after Friday’s PCE data showed U.S. inflation had stabilized, slightly boosting hopes for an earlier cut in interest rates by the Federal Reserve.

item.title: Dollar Trades Steady, U.S. Jobs Data Key
item.description: The dollar was steady in early European action and Friday’s nonfarm payrolls report will be key in determining whether the currency’s recent selloff extends further, MUFG said.

item.title: Claudia Sheinbaum Elected as Mexico's First Female President
item.description: The candidate of the leftist ruling party won by a landslide on pledges of policy continuity.

item.title: GSK Shares Tumble After Zantac Ruling
item.description: GSK shares dropped 10% after a ruling by the Delaware State Court that will allow jury trials in cases brought by cancer sufferers who say the heartburn drug Zantac caused their condition.

item.title: GenScript Biotech Shares Drop After U.S. Lawmakers Scrutinize Chinese Ties
item.description: Shares of GenScript Biotech plunged in Hong Kong amid concerns that the company could face U.S. scrutiny due to alleged ties with the Chinese government.

item.title: Asia's Fledgling Manufacturing Recovery Faces Cost Pressure
item.description: Asian manufacturers seem to be on firmer ground, with the latest survey data signaling stronger output and orders, but building cost pressures could stoke concerns about inflation.

item.title: Toyota Motor Suspends Japan Sales of Three Models on Certification Issues
item.description: Toyota Motor suspended shipments and sales of three models produced in Japan, saying they were tested using methods that differed from the Japanese government’s standards.

item.title: China's Biggest Cities Continue to Ease Home-Buying Policies
item.description: More of China’s biggest cities are easing home-buying policies, after top leaders recently signaled a shift to aggressive measures to resolve the country’s ongoing property crisis.

item.title: 'All of You Are Modi': The Making of the Man Reshaping India
item.description: Narendra Modi, likely to win a third term as India’s prime minister, was shaped by a modest upbringing and his involvement in a secretive nationalist group.

item.title: 35 Years After Tiananmen, China's Conduct Again Triggers Alarm
item.description: In 1989, the blowback against Beijing was swift, while alienation today is ‘systematic, progressive, long-term.’

item.title: A GOP Hawk Tries to Reassure a World on Edge About Trump
item.description: In Taipei and Singapore, Sen. Dan Sullivan looks to quell foreign leaders’ fears that the U.S. won’t stand by its allies if Trump wins.

item.title: Trump, who once tried to ban TikTok, joined the social-media platform and posted a 13-second clip of himself at an Ultimate Fighting Championship event in Newark, N.J.
item.description: Trump, who once tried to ban TikTok, joined the social-media platform and posted a 13-second clip of himself at an Ultimate Fighting Championship event in Newark, N.J.

item.title: Waste Management is nearing a deal to buy medical-waste-disposal company Stericycle for roughly $7 billion including debt.
item.description: Waste Management is nearing a deal to buy medical-waste-disposal company Stericycle for roughly $7 billion including debt.
